author: Nickarama
title: JUST IN: Obama Sends Forces to Russian Border…
text:
06:49pm January 4, 2017   
The U.S. has deployed U.S. Special Forces to Lithuania near the Russian border in response to Russian movements in the region. 
In October, Russia reportedly deployed nuclear-capable Iskander missiles in the nearby Russian province of Kaliningrad causing more unease among the Baltic states. 
From The Sun: 
US military chief General Raymond T Thomas told the New York Times that America has a “persistent” presence in the Baltic states bordering Russia. 
He added that many former Eastern Bloc countries are “scared to death” of Russia and the vulnerable states are “desperate” for America’s leadership. 
The US and its Nato allies will send battalions of up to 1,200 to each of the three Baltic states – Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia – and Poland by spring this year, reports the New York Times. 
Lithuania’s foreign minister Linas Linkevicius confirmed Russia’s military activity in Kaliningrad is terrifying the region. 
The United States had indicated in October the build up of forces would be coming. 
NATO’s plan is to set up four battle groups with a total of some 4,000 troops from early next year, backed by a 40,000-strong rapid-reaction force, and if need be, follow-on forces. 
As part of that, U.S. Secretary of Defense Ash Carter announced a “battle-ready battalion task force” of about 900 soldiers would be sent to eastern Poland, as well as another, separate force equipped with tanks and other heavy equipment to move across eastern Europe. 
But this comes at a time of heightened tensions between the United States and Russia. 
Relations between the United States and Russia have gotten worse since the alleged hacking involving Democratic emails which the Obama administration has blamed on Russia. 
Obama expelled 35 Russian diplomats and imposed sanctions against Russia. 
The Baltic States, having seen what happened in Ukraine and Crimea, have looked to the U.S. for leadership. 
Obama has failed in leadership in the area and now seems to be ratcheting up the language and actions in the final days of his presidency. LIKE this article?
